reviews.review: Juegazo 10/10 uno de los mejores juegos de valve que implemento y vario uno de los mejores motores graficos de todos los tiempos y con una historia buenisima con un nivel de complejidad no tan exagerado, y un lore fascinante

Es un muy buen juego lo principalmente atractivo es la construccion de mundo que se hizo a comparacion de la primera entrega el hecho de poder ir de a poco descubriendo su lore es fantastico, la jugabilidad esta bastante bien los graficos aguantan hasta la fecha. Lo unico que podria decir que no me gustaba era que en momentos muy particulares de la trama el puzzle no era dificil sino que era o poco intuitivo o no estaba del todo claro, ademas de que el sistema de guardado guarda en los peores momentos dejandote en puntos donde solo por el hecho de cargar la partida mueres por eso guarden siempre una nueva partida aunque tengan 100 mas. fuera de eso es una experiencia fabulosa que permanecera conmigo rondando mi cabeza por los proximos años hasta el proximo half life que pueda probar.

One of the most ground breaking games at its time, Half-Life 2 is a perfect example of a game that has perfected the single player FPS experience. Everything is designed meticulously for the player to pick up and understand its unique mechanics without the players being told what to do. The level is designed almost perfectly for it's, at its time, ground breaking physics system as well as its un-interrupting gameplay progression. The boat sequence can, however, induce some nausea, and its gun-play isn't the most engaging. That being said, even in 2020, it is still a marvel of a game and one of the best of its kind. -- [9/10]

Gaming Masterpiece. Although it can be grueling sometimes, the levels are very good, and the game as a whole has aged well. 9.5/10

Still a classic even after all this time. Puzzles are still just as challenging as ever and the gameplay is still fun. Yes, the visuals are now a little dated but who cares when the story and game physics are as good as this?

It's really hard to review games with such critical acclaim (AKA every Valve title ever), but Half Life 2 especially is a difficult one. Like I only played it once in 2020, but I've been hearing about it my whole life and even then it exceeded my expectations. It's so well balanced everywhere you look and it's really magic how alive the world can feel through just a computer screen. I became shockingly good at exploring and I felt nice to talk to people in this ruined world. I decided to play Half Life 2 after playing Half Life: Alyx since I have a VR and I was simply too tempted to play Alyx to play the others first. I had a weird reverse reference experience if you will. Like in Half Life Alyx you walk through the block that the raid was on in HL2 but for me, in HL2 I was walking through the block I played as Alyx in and I could see the rooftops I walked on and I felt a sense of the world really being a living place. Basically, even though I experienced these things backwards they're still impressive as all hell. Valve has some ability to make things alive and I still can't put my finger on it, but the Half Life series is brimming with it. I don't know who would be reading Half Life 2 reviews in 2020, but whoever you are, play it again, or get it if you haven't already somehow. 9/10

This game is amazing.The first time you play it is just... AmazingHighly Recommended along with the first and second episode.PROS:-Great story -Epic characters (some returning from half life 1)-Great maps-Cool secrets-Ravenholm, easily one of the best parts in the game along with highway 17 -Nice ending-And much much moreNow onto the CONS:-Pretty mediocre guns but they get the job done-Lack of vehicles -THERE IS NO EPISODE THREEOther than that this game is amazing and i highly recommend it.Verdict:9.7/10And remember this is my opinion if you disagree with me then that's okay

Es increíble como un juego envejece tan bien a pesar de haber salido hace casi 16 años a la fecha de estar escribiendo esto. Su innovación gráfica para el momento fue lo que nos dejó a todos con la boca abierta, y aún a día de hoy se mantiene bien (en especial las expresiones faciales y las físicas). Obviamente no sería justo compararlo con un juego actual, pero creo que la idea se entiende.Ofrece un gameplay inventivo que fomenta el uso del motor de físicas para avanzar en la historia, ya sea haciendo puzzles o matando enemigos tirándoles cualquier cosa con el arma anti-gravedad.La historia no deja de ser algo básica, pero dentro de sus pretenciones hace buen uso de la misma, y si hay que buscarle algo negativo al juego sería el problema de la retrocontinuidad con el primer juego, o sea, este juego nos hace pensar que Barney y Kleiner fueron personajes destacados en el primer videojuego, pero tan poca relevancia tuvieron argumentalmente en el anterior videojuego que no me termina de cuajar. Ni siquiera tuvieron un modelo de personajes característico que los diferenciara de los demás guardias o científicos, como si lo hizo Rosenberg en Decay por ejemplo.De resto, el juego me parece de los mejores que se han hecho en la historia del medio. Excelente en su día, excelente hoy, y excelente hasta el fin de los tiempos. Poco menos que una obra maestra."9.5/10"
Если ты читаешь обзоры к этой игре, то не опаздывай в детский сад.
